general: Implement a 'Light Mode' first approach. The interface should feel like a clean, well-lit butcher shop.
Use the 'Butcher Paper' texture as a subtle overlay on the main background to give it an organic feel.
Ensure all touch targets (buttons, inputs) are large (min 44px height) for ease of use by staff who might be wearing gloves or working fast.
The 'Lab View' (Dashboard) must be high-contrast and readable from a distance (like a Kitchen Display System).
Use the 'Playfair Display' font for all major headings to establish the brand identity.
Use 'Manrope' for all functional text, numbers, and order details.

component_specifics.order_ticket: Design the order card to look like a physical paper ticket. Use a dashed border at the bottom. Include a clear 'Pickup Time' in large, bold text.
component_specifics.sidebar: Use a dark sidebar (Deep Burgundy #5D1919) with white/gold text for high contrast against the light content area.
component_specifics.notifications: Use a 'Toast' system (Sonner) for new orders, but also implement a visual indicator (flashing badge) in the Lab View.

universal_guidelines: Do not use generic gradients. Use solid colors or subtle textures.
Avoid 'Inter' font. Use the specified font stack.
Ensure all interactive elements have hover states that increase contrast.
Do not center-align the main app container.
